questions.question: For which of these surfaces will friction be greatest when a block of wood slides across it?
Which of the following would cause the blades of this windmill to spin at a slower rate?

choices.answer: a decrease in the speed of wind
a decrease in the mass of the windmill's blades
a decrease in the friction of the windmill's gears
a decrease in the size and number of blades on the windmill

questions.question: A crane is used to move objects. What must cranes work against in order to lift the box upward?
Which of these is an example of a force being applied?

choices.answer: standing at the top of a hill

questions.question: 2 people push a car that is stuck in mud. Why did the car not move even when force was applied?

choices.answer: Cars are too large to be affected by the force
A force in the opposite direction balanced the push.
The people are not strong enough to exert a force on the car
The force of gravity is too strong for you to move the car

questions.question: Items travel in a straight line in space. No force is applied. What happens to the items motion

choices.answer: it will move faster because there is not force to stop it
it will soon stop because there is no force to keep it movin
it will stop suddenly when the force that started it stops
it will not change. it will continue in the same direction

questions.question: What is the definition of force?

choices.answer: movement that happens outside your body
A soccer player kicking a soccer ball
a push or pull that causes a change in motion

questions.question: Forces are pushes or pulls that ___________.

choices.answer: can change the motion or shape of an object

questions.question: Gravity is the force of attraction between ____________________.
An object moving through the air slows down because it is affected by ____________.
When balanced forces act on an object, the object ________.
In order for an object to change its speed or direction, ____________________.

choices.answer: an unbalanced force must act on it

questions.question: Two forces that are equal in size but opposite in direction are ________________.
A tool that can be used to measure the size of a force is called?
Two forces that are not equal in size are ________________.
A force that acts between two touching objects and opposes motion is called?
If the same size of force is exerted on 2 objects of differing mass, what happens to the object

choices.answer: the object with greater mass moves farther
the object with less mass moves farther
both objects will move the same distance
neither object will move at all

questions.question: The more mass an object has, the more ____________ it takes to move the object?
What is motion?

choices.answer: continuous change in the movement of an object
stationary place where an object has been

questions.question: What does it mean to repel an object?

choices.answer: to resist the force of attraction by pushing away
scale down a cliff on a rope

questions.question: The rate in which an object travels is called its ____________
The more force applied to an object, the __________________________________________.

choices.answer: more force it can absorb when contacted by another object
more force it can transfer to another object
less friction the object has because of its position
less friction the object has because of its motion

questions.question: What must object B have in order to change the direction or position of object A?

choices.answer: object B must have more force
object B must have more mass
object A must have more force
Object A must have more mass

questions.question: What purpose does wax on a bowling lane have?

choices.answer: allow the ball to stick to the lane
allow the ball to float smoothly over the lane
allow the lane to have less friction against the ball
allow the lane to shine when the lights reflect on it

questions.question: I have to move a heavy shelf across my classroom floor. Which option is NOT a valid choice?

choices.answer: empty the shelf to make it lighter
ask someone else to help me push the shelf
reduce the friction against the shelf and the floor
increase the mass of the shelf
